Description: Woman's dress; made of red-dyed cotton cloth with long sleeves widening towards cuff. Round neck; narrow front opening. Side pocket at right proper. Embroidered in multi-coloured cotton thread with geometric patterns around neck, chest and full length of front panel. Worked in satin and chain stitch. Front panel has individual motifs such as scissors, letters of Roman alphabet, double-ended arrows, stylised hands?. Inscription embroidered in yellow thread in Arabic on breast. Back of neck and centre back also embrouidered. Machine-stitched seams; hand-sewn hem.
Acquisition notes: Probably acquired in Cairo as a gift for the donor's aunt in the late 1970s or early 1980s.
